item.title: lacis
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
“Place des Arts’ screen mosaic, a unique installation composed of 35 digital screens and light tubes, presents six digital artworks on the theme of Labyrinthe, created by the UQAM’s School of Visual and Media Arts.”⠀Village numérique

Lacis is a contemplative piece meant to mimick the flow of foot traffic in the area. The digital ribbons flow indefinitely in a seamless loop, they come and go and disappear in the darkness only to come back a few seconds later.

item.title: exotopie
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
On March 8th 2025,

UQAM’s Judith-Jasmin building was transformed into an alternative universe showcasing the work of the 2022 cohort in Interactive Media.

Produced on the course of 6 months by its 22 members, the project showcased musical performances as well as interactive visuals and electronics for a singular night.

⠀Photography : Kevin Larue, Andy Martinez , Rosalie Turcotte⠀

item.title: laboratoire scénographique - MAPP_MTL x Moment Factory
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
In September 2024 I had the opportunity to be apart of the people who worked on the closing party of the MAPP_MTL festival which took place on September 29th 2024 at Moment Factory.

I have worked on multiple aspects of the event from creative works (3D and compositing) to interaction design and mapping.

The visuals on these drapes were made by⠀Anamika Deb⠀while the surface was mapped by me and⠀Bonnie Pham⠀

item.title: szklana flora
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
“szklana flora” or “La flore de verre” is a collaborative project made with polish/german producer⠀Jakub Stefaniak .

The minute long piece is a contemplative exploration of textures and colors which was shown in front of the audience of the MAPP_MTL festival on the night of the 26th of September 2024. It was then played several times throughout the span of the festival, thus until the 29th of September.

item.title: au fil de l'eau
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
au fil de l’eau is an immersive and interactive installation in which the audience is led through the depths of the ocean. the public is invited to contemplate and listen to the flora and fauna which inhabits these waters as well as interacting in various ways to affect this environment.

During the making of this group project I have worked on real-time fluid simulation, and I have developped the 3D aspects of the depths as well as the interactive components which were routed in between Touchdesigner and Unreal Engine.

item.title: plasma waves
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
Plasma waves is a collaborative and ever-evolving project with multidisciplinary artist Santiago Betancour (a.k.a EscapedMind).

The project is an exploration of the relation between water and electricity, it uses an improvised instrument, a plasma ball from which we record the vibrations caused by its man controlled disruption.

The ambient soundscape is accompanied by interactive visuals with the purpose of offering an experience that you can sense from both sight and hearing.

item.title: about me
item.author: alexandrebeuz121@gmail.com (Alexandre Beuzen)
item.description:
Hi I’m Alexandre Beuzen, a Master of Design student at Concordia University where I currently focus on experimental game design.

I’m interested in everything related to media arts. I have a self-taught background in graphic design, but I quickly turned my focus to immersive and interactive installations during my time at the University of Quebec in Montréal.

If you enjoy my work, please don’t hesitate to reach out to me.
